item.title: Tunisia President Kais Saied accused of coup amid clashes
item.description: Months of tension over Covid and the economy culminate in the sacking of the prime minister.

item.title: US accused of demonising China in high-level talks
item.description: US Deputy Secretary of State Wendy Sherman is the most senior official to visit under Mr Biden.

item.title: Sandstorm swallows city in northwestern China
item.description: Dust clouds towered at least 100 metres (330ft) over Dunhuang.

item.title: Afghanistan: Record civilian casualties in 2021, UN reports
item.description: More than 1,600 civilians have been killed so far in 2021, and the UN fears a further rise.

item.title: German lawyers wrangle over pensioner's WW2 tank in basement
item.description: The 84-year-old kept the vehicle in his basement, along with an anti-aircraft gun and a torpedo.

item.title: Greece seeks spear fisher who killed famous seal
item.description: Kostis, a rare Mediterranean monk seal rescued as a pup, is killed by a spear gun.

item.title: AKO Caine Prize: Meron Hadero named first Ethiopian winner
item.description: Judges praised Meron Hadero's short story The Street Sweep which ends in a "clever twist".

item.title: Nikola Tesla: Sparks fly over plans to honour inventor with coin
item.description: Both Croatia and Serbia claim Nikola Tesla, pioneer of alternating current electricity, as their hero.

item.title: White House: US to maintain Covid foreign travel restrictions
item.description: The White House says current rules will remain due to rising cases and variant transmission.

item.title: Deadly street protests over Iran water shortages
item.description: Khuzestan is one of the country's hottest regions, where temperatures can reach 50C.

item.title: Climate change: Researchers begin discussions on vital report
item.description: A two-week virtual negotiation begins on the most critical climate change report since 2013.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Momiji Nishiya wins skateboarding gold at just 13
item.description: At the age of 13, Japan's Momiji Nishiya wins the first-ever Olympic gold medal in women's street skateboarding.

item.title: How US pullback in Iraq could benefit Iran
item.description: The withdrawal of remaining US combat troops could help Iran achieve its ambitions.

item.title: Unesco adds Madrid's Paseo del Prado and Retiro Park to heritage list
item.description: The famous Paseo del Prado and Retiro Park are symbols of the Spanish capital's history.

item.title: Nigerian outrage at brazen bandit attacks
item.description: The shooting down of a military jet shows how organised crime is becoming more daring by the day.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: One athlete braved sharks and crocodiles
item.description: Training for the Olympics can be a full-time job but Jo Brigden-Jones has combined it with much more.

item.title: Maharashtra: How one city avoided worst of India floods
item.description: At least 149 people have died across the Indian state this monsoon season.

item.title: Covid-19: Recent claims about cremations and vaccines fact-checked
item.description: Debunking claims shared widely on social media about cremations in the UK and US vaccine statistics.

item.title: Excitement over wooden shipwreck found in Antigua's seabed
item.description: Historians believe the wreck found in Antigua to be the 1762 Beaumont, a French merchant ship.

item.title: Tunisia: Key moments as political turmoil unfolds
item.description: Tunisia's president sacks the PM and the speaker is barred entry to parliament following violent protests.

item.title: Rockslide destroys bridge in northern India
item.description: It was one of several landslides in Himachal Pradesh on Sunday.

item.title: Afrobeats in Japan: British-Nigerian hip hop dancer teaching children how to dance
item.description: Yinka Oshiletu, a British-Nigerian hip hop dancer is bringing Afrobeats sounds to Japan's young dancers.

item.title: Wildfires spread from California to Nevada
item.description: Fire crews are battling extreme temperatures to control wildfires in California and Nevada.

item.title: ICYMI: World's deepest pool and a royal ritual resumes
item.description: Here's a round-up of the week's news you might have missed.

item.title: Slowest qualifier wins shock swimming title
item.description: Tunisia's Ahmed Hafnaoui takes a shock gold medal in the men's 400m freestyle on Sunday.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: German women's gymnastics team wears full-body suits
item.description: Germany's gymnasts wear full-body suits in women's qualification at the Olympics as they continue their stand against the sexualisation of their sport.

item.title: Austrian wins shock Olympic cycling gold
item.description: Austria's Anna Kiesenhofer launches a remarkable solo breakaway to win road race gold on her Olympic debut, as Britain's Lizzie Deignan finishes 11th.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics medals table
item.description: Medals table for the 2020 Olympics in Tokyo.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Naomi Osaka 'refreshed' for 'nerve-wracking' Games debut in Japan
item.description: A "refreshed" Naomi Osaka says it was "nerve-wracking" to compete in the Olympics in her home country of Japan after her first-round win.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Japan's Yuto Horigome makes history with sport's first ever gold
item.description: Yuto Horigome celebrates winning Japan's third gold medal as the Tokyo native claims victory in the inaugural men's street skateboarding final.

item.title: What is 3x3 basketball?
item.description: On Saturday we finally saw what 3x3 Olympic basketball is all about - but what is it, and who stood out on day one?

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Day-by-day guide to the key events, big stars and British medal hopes
item.description: Want to know what's happening when in Tokyo? Check out our comprehensive guide to all the action in Japan.
